title.value: How to erase data from a hard drive

body.value:
It is important to safely remove all data from each donated laptop or PC . Labdoo recommends to overwrite the disc 3-times by random data, so no reconstruction of the former data will be possible. To do so there are several options:
by deleting data during installing an image for Cloning via Parted Magic CD iso code (more details in the Wiki-contributions)
by using Shell and terminal code or
using the program Disk Eraser (icon on the Parted Magic Desktop)
during the installation of the (L)Ubuntu OS
Power on the laptop and press F12 key immediately into the boot device mode.
Insert the Lubuntu DVD in the CD/DVD drive.
Use the up and down key to select the option to "boot from CD/DVD drive" and then hit the "Enter" twice to enter into the Lunbuntu window.
After entering into the Lunbuntu, hold down "Alt" "Ctrl" "F3" keys at the same time
Type the following line at the prompt: sudo shred /dev/sda -f -v
It might take a few hours. You can follow how the job progresses by the % shown on the screen.
Note: If you have problems or for technical reasons it might be helpful to give the donated laptop to a Labdoo hub. A Labdoo hub will help you and delte all data on the disc.
